title: Jools.Holland.Highlights
description:
Please see torrent #10909871 for details about most of the files contained in *this* torrent.

As it turns out I have a utility installed on my system that allows me to place the same file in many different locations without having to make a new copy of the file. Thus I can seed this torrent simultaneously with #10909871 which contains the same files identically, but located elsewhere.

That way I can cumulatively add to this collection as I acquire more episodes and selections from the Jools Holland programs.

As it stands, the layout for this torrent has, as a part of its overall structure, the directory structure for torrent 10909871. Thankfully the latest additions do not have any extra "Dolby" sub-component, because I finally repaired my system to allow me to play videos with 6 channel Dolby audio on my two speakers without any speed-ups or delays or any other synchronizations problems.

I will not merge the Dolby audio for the preceding torrent's files because then it would be required for you to download all of the files in this torrent in order to complete its download even if you had all of #10909871 (well, it *could* be done, but it would be a pain in the ass).

As it is now and will remain in torrents to come, the directory structure looks like this:

The root for these Jools Holland clips will always be under the "Jools.Holland.Highlights" folder. Hence, if you already have the files from torrent #10909871, then you would move the "Jools.Holland.SE44.Highlights.1080p" folder immediately below "Jools.Holland.Highlights". Then force a re-check which will succeed given what you already have. The new files (SE36.E06) will download into their appropriate locations.

As I add more videos under, say the "Season 36" category, then I will rename the folder as appropriate. If you wanted to maintain the structure and not re-download anything, then you'd rename the SE36 folder exactly as indicated in the torrent followed by a forced re-check.

Here are all the tracks I have so far:

---------------------------------------

So as you can see, I've added 4 new tracks and one interview. 3 tracks by Macy Gray (plus an interview with her) and one track from a band (yes a band!) called "White Rabbits". They performed, I think 3 songs? but I only liked the last one.
